t: Amazon announces its largest reduction in plastic packaging in North America to date
s: June 20, 2024 - Amazon has replaced 95% of the plastic air pillows from delivery packaging in North America with paper filler, working toward full removal by the end of the year.

t: How Amazon is improving packaging and boosting sustainability

t: Wood Plastic Composite

t: Inside Amazon’s push to switch from plastic to paper mailers | Trellis
s: March 11, 2024 - Amazon has cut more than 37,150 tons of plastic packaging since 2020, but still uses twice that amount annually.

t: Amazon acknowledges plastic packaging is “not yet recyclable”
s: October 31, 2024 - While Amazon’s classic blue and white bubble-lined plastic bags have traditionally been labeled with a recycling symbol and instructions for recycling at a store drop-off location, the latest similar packaging now comes with a slash through the recycling symbol.

t: Exposed: Amazon's enormous and rapidly growing plastic pollution problem | Oceana
s: July 20, 2023 - By combining the e-commerce packaging data with findings from a recent study published in Science, Oceana estimates that up to 23.5 million pounds of Amazon’s plastic packaging waste entered and polluted the world’s waterways and oceans in 2020, the equivalent of dumping a delivery van ...
